title: Restrictions (tvOS) (com.apple.applicationaccess)
description: The payload that configures restrictions on a device.

allowDeviceNameModification.title: Allow Modifying Device Name
allowDeviceNameModification.description: If 'false', the system prevents the user from changing the device name.

forceAutomaticDateAndTime.title: Force automatic date and time
forceAutomaticDateAndTime.description: If 'true', the system enables the Set Automatically feature in Date & Time and the user can't disable it. The system updates the device's time zone only when the device can determine its location using a cellular connection or Wi-Fi with location services enabled.

allowAutomaticScreenSaver.title: Allow Automatic Screen Saver
allowAutomaticScreenSaver.description: If 'false', the system disables Apple TV's automatic screen saver.

allowCamera.title: Allow Camera Use
allowCamera.description: If 'false', the system disables the camera and removes its icon from the Home Screen, and users are unable to take photographs. Support for this restriction on unsupervised devices is deprecated.

allowCloudPrivateRelay.title: Allow iCloud Private Relay
allowCloudPrivateRelay.description: If set to false, prevents the use of iCloud Private Relay.

blockedAppBundleIDs.title: Blocked Apps
blockedAppBundleIDs.description:
If present, the system prevents showing or launching apps with bundle IDs in the array. Include the value 'com.apple.webapp' to restrict all webclips. This applies to App Store apps, marketplace apps, and locally installed apps (using Configurator, Xcode, and so forth).

Note:
Denying system apps may disable other functionality. For example, denying the App Store app may prevent users from accepting the terms and conditions for the user-based Volume Purchase Program (VPP).

allowListedAppBundleIDs.title: Allow Listed Apps
allowListedAppBundleIDs.description: If present, the system only shows or can launch apps with bundle IDs in the array. Include the value 'com.apple.webapp' to allow all webclips. This applies to App Store apps, marketplace apps, and locally installed apps (using Configurator, Xcode, and so forth).

forceAssistantProfanityFilter.title: Enable Siri profanity filter
forceAssistantProfanityFilter.description: When true, forces the use of the profanity filter assistant.

ratingRegion.title: Region Code
ratingRegion.description: The two-letter key that profile tools use to display the proper ratings for the given region. The client doesn't recognize or report this data.

ratingApps.title: Allowed content ratings - Apps
ratingApps.description:
The maximum level of app content allowed on the device. Preinstalled (first-party) apps ignore this restriction.

Possible values, with the U.S. description of the rating level:

- '1000': All
- '600': 17+
- '300': 12+
- '200': 9+
- '100': 4+
- '0': None

Age bands and the number of discrete age values vary by region, but the values are consistent across regions. For example, in a region that defines rating level 14+, its value is guaranteed to be larger than 300 (12+) and smaller than 600 (17+). Also, the value of rating level 15+ is guaranteed to be larger than the assigned value of rating level 14+. For more information about age ratings, see [Age ratings values and definitions](https://developer.apple.com/help/app-store-connect/reference/age-ratings-values-and-definitions).

Examples of values in other regions include:

- '1000': All
- '621': 21+
- '620': 20+
- '619': 19+
- '618': 18+
- '600': 17+
- '416': 16+
- '415': 15+
- '314': 14+
- '313': 13+
- '300': 12+
- '211': 11+
- '210': 10+
- '200': 9+
- '108': 8+
- '107': 7+
- '106': 6+
- '105': 5+
- '100': 4+
- '3': 3+
- '2': 2+
- '1': 1+
- '0': None

This restriction will require supervision in a future release.

ratingMovies.title: Allowed content ratings - Movies
ratingMovies.description:
The maximum level of movie content allowed on the device. Support for this restriction on unsupervised devices is deprecated.

Possible values, with the U.S. description of the rating level:

- '1000': All
- '500': NC-17
- '400': R
- '300': PG-13
- '200': PG
- '100': G
- '0': None

ratingTVShows.title: Allowed content ratings - TV Shows
ratingTVShows.description:
The maximum level of TV content allowed on the device. Support for this restriction on unsupervised devices is deprecated.

Possible values, with the U.S. description of the rating level:

- '1000': All
- '600': TV-MA
- '500': TV-14
- '400': TV-PG
- '300': TV-G
- '200': TV-Y7
- '100': TV-Y
- '0': None

allowExplicitContent.title: Allow Explicit Content
allowExplicitContent.description:
If 'false', the system hides explicit music or video content purchased from the iTunes Store. The system marks explicit content as such by content providers, such as record labels, when sold through the iTunes Store. Explicit content in the News and Podcast apps is also hidden.

Requires a supervised device in iOS 13 and later. Support for this restriction on unsupervised devices is deprecated.

allowBookstoreErotica.title: Allow Bookstore Erotica
allowBookstoreErotica.description: If 'false', the system prevents the user from downloading Apple Books media that's tagged as erotica. Support for this restriction on unsupervised devices is deprecated.

allowAirPlayIncomingRequests.title: Allow incoming AirPlay requests
allowAirPlayIncomingRequests.description: If 'false', the system disables incoming AirPlay requests.

forceAirPlayIncomingRequestsPairingPassw.title: Require passcode on first AirPlay pairing
forceAirPlayIncomingRequestsPairingPassw.description: If 'true', the system forces all devices sending AirPlay requests to this device to use a pairing password. This key isn't supported in tvOS 10.2 and later. Use the AirPlay Security Payload instead.

allowRemoteAppPairing.title: Allow pairing with Remote app
allowRemoteAppPairing.description: If 'false', the system disables pairing Apple TV for use with the Control Center widget.

allowPasswordProximityRequests.title: Allow proximity based password sharing requests
allowPasswordProximityRequests.description: If 'false', the system disables requesting passwords from nearby devices.

forceDelayedSoftwareUpdates.title: Defer Software Updates
forceDelayedSoftwareUpdates.description: If 'true', the system delays user visibility of software updates. In macOS, the system allows seed build updates without delay. The delay is 30 days unless you set 'enforcedSoftwareUpdateDelay' to another value.

enforcedSoftwareUpdateDelay.title: Deferred Software Updates Delay
enforcedSoftwareUpdateDelay.description: How many days to delay a software update on the device. With this restriction in place, the user doesn't see a software update until the specified number of days after the software update release date. The restrictions 'forceDelayedAppSoftwareUpdates' and 'forceDelayedSoftwareUpdates' use this value.

allowDeviceSleep.title: Allow Device Sleep
allowDeviceSleep.description: If 'false', the system prevents the device from automatically sleeping.
